answerText: homolytic cleavage [or word forms, such as homolysis][10] Homolytic cleavage of a neutral molecule generates two of these extremely-reactive species with unpaired electrons, which can wreak havoc in the human body unless stopped by antioxidants.
heading: PADAWAN |2014 | 1 | 14 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Identify this kind of bond-breaking symbolized by fishhook arrows, wherein each atom retains one of the electrons from the bond.
